intro: Senecio tamoides, commonly known as the yellow starbursts, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk, giving it a starburst appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or sandy environments. Senecio tamoides is popular in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
